intro: Senecio katubensis, commonly known as the Katubeni groundsel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. It features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
